relation: For fun there are sooooo many events on campus. There are different organizations and sports to join to stay active. Also, look out for parties thrown by your classmates on facebook and twitter.
Dining dollars were most definitely a plus. The cafe food is ok sometimes.

Depending on where you are living is how your dorm life experience will be. My freshman year I stayed in Strozier main which is one of the final traditional dorms on campus. It was very small and I had a very bad ant problem. I wanted to go home :) but I stuck it out.
Academics are rigor but most definitely useful and interesting. Make sure that your major is something that you are interested in so that going to class becomes something you enjoy.

For prospctive students come with a ope mind because college is most definitely a big difference from high school. You have more freedom and more time on your hands, which could serve as a good and a bad thing. Just manage your time well and make the best out of everything. You may have to do stuff you never one before to enjoy your stay here because after all this is Carrollton (the country) and it's a big difference from the city.
As the saying goes,Great things happen when you go west. West Georgia is by far one of the most academic and social inclined schools. It was one of the bet decisons I made!
pageTitle: University of West Georgia (UWG) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {593867=Center Pointe is nice. The Oaks are going to be new this upcoming Fall2013 so it'll be clean. All in all, the dorms are nice. The traditional dorms are going under renovations or have gone. If you can, try to get the newer rooms, but consider prices., 395237=Most of the dorms are your typical ones. New dorms are currently being built. They range in the $2000-$3000 a semester., 588644=Every single day at 2:30 pm everyone stops what they're doing & dances, no matter where you are!, 146360=fortunately the university of west georgia are building new and fresh freshman dorms for the incoming freshman of 2012. the dorms are very well kept and stay clean.the residents and residential assistants will make your dorm experience even better !, 383295=APPLY FOR EVERYTHING EARLY!!! And by early, I mean January. Most scholarship deadlines are in February, and housing options fill up so quickly that you won't know what hit you. Apply early., 543928=Every Fall Semester we have a parade for the freshmen class. We march to the flame and light the flame during the parade! There will be two surprises during the parade ;), 92766=The dorms are really nice, they are currently working on renovating and remodeling dorms that will be open during the 2012-2013 school year., 285332=2:30 dance time, you have to stop what your doing and dance any where, you are., 262682=Definitely sign up for orientation. There is a fee but it's so worth it; it's only May and I already have my fall schedule and student ID!, 447920=Each place you live will be different, you might get the crazy roommate or the obnoxious one, and there will always be the drunk loud mouths at 1:30 in the morning., 825092=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 291163=Have not started any classes. Will not start until Fall of 2012. I went on rate my professer. I also asked around and most people say all the professers are very helpful. There is also alot of free tutoring on campus and help.}

textAfterTable: Stephanie from Temple, GA 01/18/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 21 out of 22 people found this review useful. 2 of 187 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Students that are interested in Sororities/Fraternities because they built a Greek village which has a ton of houses for the different sororities/fraternities. West Georgia has a great nursing program as well. Tips for prospective students As I have stated before, use your time wisely! The biggest change from high school to college is the responsibility. Set a pace for yourself and you'll do fine. DO NOT PROCRASTINATE! Procrastination leads to the overwhelming feeling and eventually becomes your enemy. The website www.ratemyprofessor.com is really handy. Check it out. Bang for the buck I like the fact that West Georgia isn't too expensive, and so do my parents. Am enjoying being here I am a commuter, just like a lot of other students that attend West Georgia, so for me, it
